DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study determine whether intervention ( pre-procedure telephone call investigator ) reduce anxiety woman undergo urodynamic testing ( UDT ) compare usual care . Our hypothesis woman receive intervention report less anxiety immediately UDT woman receive usual care .
DOC.brief_title: Urodynamic Testing : Can Improve Patient Experience ?
DOC.detailed_description: This non-blinded , randomize control trial . The clinical trial investigate whether telephone call investigator one week prior urodynamic testing ( UDT ) decrease patient pre-procedure anxiety , improve patient-reported preparedness increase satisfaction compare usual care . Patients schedule UDT inform study . If patient agrees participate study , randomize one 2 group base week schedule UDT . Group 1 : Standard counseling . This group receive standard counsel Boston Urogynecology Associates ( BUA ) patient would receive schedule urodynamic testing . This counsel include description procedure handout urodynamic testing . On day test participant ask complete brief survey experience testing . The investigator also collect information medical record , age prior urogynecologic procedure . Group 2 : Standard counseling plus intervention . The participant assign intervention group receive standard counseling BUA patient schedule urodynamic test receive ( like assign group 1 ) . This counsel include description procedure handout urodynamic testing . In addition , participant receive phone call investigator 1 week test talk procedure . The investigator call participant document duration phone call question ask participant . On day test participant ask complete survey group 1 . Surveys give participant day UDT appointment include : 1 . A pre-UDT questionnaire include question demographic , overall anxiety , anxiety specific element procedure , self-reported preparedness satisfaction . 2 . A brief post-UDT questionnaire address test experience pain .
DOC.criteria: 1 . 18 year great 2 . Female 3 . Patients decide schedule Urodynamic Testing followup lower urinary tract dysfunction , pelvic organ prolapse , and/or urinary incontinence 1 . Pregnant 2 . Presence indwell catheter 3 . History prior Urodynamic Testing
